result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray Daniel Bahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court recommends this case to the Mental Health Unit of the probation department.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

Mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment recommended by the probation department.
Complete Batterers Intervention class.
Complete a parenting class.
Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray Daniel Bahr

Defendant Ray Daniel Bahr in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing.

Parties are reqeusting a new plea and sentencing hearing date.
Case is adjourned to 9-30-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ray Daniel Bahr in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing.  Case is adjourned to 8-1-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Defendant Ray Daniel Bahr in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ray Daniel Bahr appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and needs discovery and offer and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DD and AMB. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ray Daniel Bahr in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
